hook: The most valuable vehicle in Santa Clara right now isn't a team bus or a limo—it's a beat-up, unbranded white Ford Transit van.

sections.title: Checkpoint Charlie
key_points: Major food vendors are being denied entry at the Tasman Drive delivery gates.
The issue isn't security clearance, but 'Ambush Marketing' violations.
Trucks with non-sponsor logos are being turned around immediately.
stats_facts: Three major vendors rejected this morning.
NFL 'Brand Protection' officers stationed alongside physical security.
Violation: 'Vehicle Brand Neutrality Standards' for SB60.
sections.transition: With tons of food stranded on the wrong side of the fence, logistics managers are scrambling for a solution that doesn't exist.

sections.title: The White Van Scramble
key_points: Vendors are frantically renting plain white vans to shuttle goods.
Local rental agencies have been stripped bare of inventory.
The 'Clean Zone' loophole requires vehicles to be visually generic.
stats_facts: Enterprise and Penske in San Jose/Santa Clara report zero cargo inventory.
Quote: 'It's the White Van Scramble. If you have a plain white truck right now, you can charge triple.'
Rental rates for unbranded cargo vans have spiked 300%.
sections.transition: But even if they find a van, the clock is ticking down to the ultimate deadline.

sections.title: The Hard Freeze
key_points: The stadium perimeter seals tight at midnight.
After the freeze, no deliveries are allowed without federal escort.
Crews are racing to move perishables before the lock turns.
stats_facts: 4,000 pounds of brisket currently sitting in a Sunnyvale lot.
The 'Hard Freeze' protocol is absolute—no exceptions for late arrivals.
sections.transition: The reason for this chaos isn't national security—it's the billion-dollar business of exclusivity.

sections.title: The Brand Police
key_points: The NFL is enforcing 'Clean Zone' rules on transient vehicles.
Sponsors like Pepsi and Frito-Lay have exclusivity rights.
Local bakery or produce logos are considered 'Ambush Marketing'.
stats_facts: Specific bans on mascots and non-approved fruit brands.
Quote: 'They told us to duct tape the logo or turn around.'
sections.transition: For the local businesses caught in the crossfire, the cost of doing business just went up.

sections.title: The Duct Tape Solution
key_points: Crews are manually taping over logos on 53-foot trailers.
It is a desperate, labor-intensive measure to get goods inside.
The loading dock looks like a fleet of ghost trucks.
stats_facts: Quote: 'We don't have enough tape for a 53-foot trailer.'
Visual irony: The world's biggest event is being stocked by taped-up trucks.
sections.transition: By tomorrow morning, the stadium will be fully stocked, but the fleet parked in the loading dock will look like a ghost fleet.
